meanings.sent1: The soft sandstone is erosible by the constant wind and rain.
meanings.sent2: The cliffs along the coast are erosible due to the crashing waves.
meanings.sent3: The erosible soil seemed to disappear overnight after the heavy rainfall.
meanings.sent4: Her patience was as erosible as a sandcastle at high tide.
meanings.sent5: The erosible nature of the material made it unsuitable for long-term use.

meanings.sent1: The erosible rocks crumbled easily under pressure.
meanings.sent2: The erosible landscape changed constantly with the shifting weather patterns.
meanings.sent3: The erosible coastline played a game of hide and seek with the advancing sea.
meanings.sent4: His trust in others was as erosible as the shoreline during a storm.
meanings.sent5: The erosible nature of the terrain made it challenging for construction projects.
